name: 生物多樣性甲
goals: Lectures and presentations are designed to provide a fundamental knowledge of biodiversity and the current progress of biodiversity researches

Students will have deeper understanding of the ecological relationship between human society and other organisms or ecosystems and ruminate future agenda and difficulties in biodiversity conservation.
syllabus:
Week 1

**\[An overview of biodiversity and its significance\]**

What is Biodiversity?

Why is Biodiversity so important?

Week 2

**\[Biodiversity of genes or subcellular molecules\]**

Diversification of Gene

Week 3

**\[Biodiversity of species\]**

Biodiversity of Plant

Week 4

Biodiversity of Ants

Week 5

Biodiversity of Crustacean

Week 6

Biodiversity of Shell

Week 7

Biodiversity of Cnidarian

Week 8

Biodiversity of Zooplankton

Week9

Midterm

Week10

Biodiversity of Prokaryotes

Week 11

Biodiversity of Viruses

Week 12

**\[Biodiversity of ecosystems\]**

Environmental Conditions and Phytoplankton Biodiversity

Week 13

Comparative Biodiversity of Coral Reefs

Week 14

**\[Biodiversity of continentals and beyond\]**

Biodiversity and Global Environmental Change

Week 15

Biodiversity Conservation and Management

Week 16

Invited speech

Week 17

Student presentation

Week 18

Student presentation and Handing over essays
prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
